B12UJvL_X.content: <- Toggle state of the LED when our tag is detected

HJPolPIuQ.content:
<- Check out the UID of your tag and then just bind
this values into `my-card` node

ryqtkDU_Q.content: <- Compare an UID of detected tag with our UID

H185bw8_X.content: <- Detect an NFC tag and read its UID. This is a required step to read or write data to the tag

H1bauwIOQ.content: <- Check whether the tickets remained on the NFC tag and returns tickets count or `0`

S1hEuw8O7.content: <- Read number of tickets from an NFC tag. We store it in the highest byte

Sy_5Dv8d7.content: <- A detailed description of using these nodes is in the example `example-read-page`

r1FFKvU_m.content: <- If there was an unused ticket the led will blink once, if not — it will blink several times

rJFtdDUO7.content: <- Convert byte into number, subtract one ticket and convert backward

rkiwYv8uQ.content: <- Write remained tickets on the NFC tag

rkyiLv8dm.content: <- Constant to read/write a data to the same page

ryUQDD8_X.content: <- Pulse once when NFC tag detected to avoid write-off of several tickets

B1xa5wI_7.content: <- Blink 3 times to notify that writing is complete

BJ_LjDUOm.content: <- Pulse once when an NFC tag is detected

BkGvOqPLuQ.content: <- Detect an NFC tag and read its UID. This is a **required step** to read or write data to the tag

HJ9JMCHfH.description: The UID of an NFC tag

@/is-empty.description: Checks whether a UID is empty which corresponds to “no tag”

B1vSAzDPGr.description: The UID of a readed NFC tag
B1vSAzDPGr.label: UID

Byr0GwwMB.description: True when the most recent scan detected an NFC tag
Byr0GwwMB.label: TAG

SJnAfwPMB.description: Triggers scan for an NFC tag continuously while `True`.
SJnAfwPMB.label: ACT

r1LrRzPwGH.description: A port number for the interrupt request
r1LrRzPwGH.label: IRQ

@/nfc-scanner.description:
A quick-start node which represents an RFID/NFC module.
Initializes the module and reads the UID of a detected card

Possible errors:
— Initialization error

@/nfc-uid.description:
Constructs the UID type from bytes.
If the UID is shorter than 7 bytes it begins from the first position
and the rest of bytes are equal to zero

BysY2PaDQ.description: Trigger reading from an NFC tag
BysY2PaDQ.label: READ

HkrKnPpwX.description: A page number to read data from in range [0, 16]. Notice that first pages contains UID
HkrKnPpwX.label: PAGE

@/read-page.description:
Reads one page of a Mifare Ultralight NFC tag.
To read data from a tag it should be paired first (use `pair-tag`)

Possible errors:
— Can't read the value

Sk3BHM2Pm.description: The UID of the paired NFC tag
Sk3BHM2Pm.label: UID

rytEHf3vm.description: Triggers pairing with an NFC tag
rytEHf3vm.label: PAIR

rywIrfhP7.description: Fires if there is no NFC tag
rywIrfhP7.label: NA

@/pair-tag.description: Pairs module with an NFC tag and reads the UID

BklWqO6PQ.description: Trigger writing to an NFC tag
BklWqO6PQ.label: UPD

SyJkqdpPQ.description: A page number to write data to in range [0, 16]. Notice that first pages contains UID
SyJkqdpPQ.label: PAGE

@/write-page.description:
Writes data to the specified page of a Mifare Ultralight NFC tag.
To write data to a tag it should be paired first (use `pair-tag`)

Possible errors:
— Can't write the value

Byp7wJUfS.description: Reference UID of an NFC tag
Byp7wJUfS.label: REF

S19DPkIfr.description: Returns `True` if UIDs are not equal and `UID` is not empty.
S19DPkIfr.label: BAD

rkHuzn6NMH.description: A UID of an NFC tag
rkHuzn6NMH.label: UID

@/validate-uid.description:
Compares an UID of the NFC  tag with the reference UID.
Returns `False` on both outputs if the UID of NFC tag is empty.

@/unpack-nfc-uid.description:
Destructs the UID type to bytes
If the UID of the tag is longer than 7 bytes, then the first 7 bytes will be
here and the rest are cut off

description: Support for RFID/NFC modules based on a PN532 chip.
name: pn532-nfc
